intro: Pavonia galpiniana, commonly known as the Galpin's wood rose, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has a woody stem with opposite leaves. It is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate some drought conditions. The flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their ornamental value.
